intro: Deppea floribunda, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cool, humid climates. Its leaves are usually large, heart-shaped, and covered in a fine pubescence. Deppea floribunda is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is appreciated for its ability to thrive in challenging environmental conditions.
